headline: Blackened Salmon Fillets
description: Fire up succulent blackened salmon with an exciting blend of Cajun-style spices, cooked in butter for a flavorful and easy spin on this favorite fish.

video.description: Cajun-style, pan-seared salmon that will be sure to wake up your taste buds.
video.name: Blackened Salmon Fillets

name: Blackened Salmon Fillets
recipeIngredient: 4 salmon fillets, skin and bones removed

recipeInstructions.text: Mix paprika, cayenne pepper, onion powder, salt, white and black pepper, thyme, basil, and oregano together in a small bowl.
Brush salmon fillets on both sides with 1/4 cup butter, and sprinkle evenly with the spice mixture.

Heat 2 tablespoons melted butter in a large, heavy skillet over high heat. Add salmon and cook until blackened, 2 to 5 minutes. Lift fillets, add remaining melted butter to the skillet, and flip fillets into the butter. Cook until the other side is blackened and fish flakes easily with a fork, 3 to 5 minutes.

review.reviewBody: Absolutely delicious! I added garlic and 1 tsp of salt to the seasonings and only used half of the butter called for as I had 3 pieces of salmon instead of four, and had seasoning left over. I served it with jasmine rice with parsley and sauteed peppers and onions. It was awesome!
Good recipe. But too salty. I cut the salt almost in half, and it was still salty. I may have been a little heavy on the rub. I also cut down the cayenne. We will be making this again.
I made it exactly as written. It was fabulous!!!
This was a very tasty recipe with not too much of a spicy kick to it. The flavors balanced nicely and the fish was a hit!
Very good! We had it with rice and dark veggies and was absolutely great!

I made this with cod and my family really liked it. I pan fried it for about 2 mins /side (each piece was about 3 inches long). It was too spicy for us and I only used 1/2 of the cayenne pepper. I think next time I will reduce the black pepper as well. Otherwise it was delicious!
No, changes or notes. Delicious
Great, quick and tasty recipe! I love the spice.

Excellent flavor!! Might use a little less cayenne pepper next time for my husband, but this dish is definitely a keeper!! Served with sautéed fresh green beans, both taking the same amount of time to cook. Yummy!!

Great. I use 1/2 olive oil 1/2 butter. Slip season solode down on cast iron grill heated as high as you can on the bbq. Then season top before closing grill. Flip after 2 minutes and grill other side foe 2 minutes.
Nope cooked as described
I added a little more on each measurement. Turned out great.
I scaled back on the peppers a little, but everything else went so well. My family and I loved it...

This was excellent--my mom called it "the best salmon ever!" I changed very little, other than to use 1 tsp cayenne pepper instead of 1 TBSP and since I've had bad luck trying to sear anything in butter I just seared one side in olive oil and then stuck it skin side up under the broiler. It turned out great, although I might add more cayenne pepper!

Outstanding recipe! I cooked it in my cast iron skillet and did not get it blackened as i hoped but it was delicious! I baked the red potatoes with olive oil and Weber's garlic/parmesan seasoning, and added broccoli with a dash of cheese!!!
I half the cayenne.
Quick,easy and delicious

Made the Cajun spice exactly as written. It’s plenty spicy and I like heat, so reduce cayenne and pepper if you don’t. Heated up a well-seasoned cast iron skillet on medium high and used olive oil instead of butter. Turned burner down to medium low and cooked salmon for 4 minutes on one side. Flipped, covered and turned heat (gas burner) to low for 3 minutes. Perfect!

This really was delicious. I didn’t have dried thyme or basil so did a mix of the other spices. I put melted butter on filet and rubbed in spice mixture and placed on buttered hot iron skillet.Because I didn’t want to take the time to take the skin off I flipped and cooked until done. My husband really loved it.
This is my favorite way to prepare salmon
Best salmon I've ever tasted!
We both loved the recipe just as written. The only thing was I had my heat up a touch too high, and it did cause quite a bit of smoking. Next time, will do it on the grill.

I made this on my George Foreman grill using a pound of individually frozen filets and cooking 3 min. Half a recipe of the rub coated them all generously but OMGEEEEE the spiciness was overwhelmingly painful. I will cut the cayenne to an 1/8 of t or less next time around
All I had to do was thaw the fish. Followed recipe step by step.
I made it with cod instead and it worked the same! Great flavors!

Absolutely loved this. I saw many people post they didn’t use the butter but I did and it is fantastic! I also grilled them instead of baking them and it gave them such a good flavor. Every single but was packed full of flavor and had not fishy taste at all. Highly recommend!
great. I doubled the blackening seasoning mix and saved half so it would be very easy to make this again.
We love this seasoning! Very spicy!!!
This is great! Crisp and blackened on the outside, while tender and cooked on the inside! And the seasoning really packs a punch! I usually don't like salmon but wow

The family liked it. I knew it would be too much cayenne, so I only used 1/2 teaspoon. Otherwise, I made it as written.

Next time I will use half the salt and butter (or sub with olive oil).
Spicy I had to add balsamic glaze to ease the spicyness
Yum! Don't change a thing

OMG, OMG, try this and it's the only Blackened Mix you will ever use. This makes as good as ANY restaurant Blackened fish I've had here in FL. I've used it on Atlantic Salmon, Tilapia, Shrimp, Scallops and even Chicken...... Super Doper on the grill too. Mix as recipe, if too hot for you...then cut back a bit on the Cayenne .... Wonderful flavor!!!
My family loves this. I drizzled some honey on top after it was done.
Loved it, but would cut the salt in half
I have used this for all kinds of fish. it's an excellent recipe.
Terrific spice mixture. I could've used more and added a bit more cayenne

Better than in a restaurant! Best thing I've cooked in my iron skillet. Browns nice and crispy. I halved the cayenne. Timing was correct as written. I used butter instead of olive oil because it gives it a nice flavor. Side salad goes perfectly. Amazing!
Absolutely delicious!!
I keep this seasoning on hand at all times now. It's my go to for fish and chicken.
I doubled the recipe since I was cooking for more. Turned out great. I did it exactly like the recipe.

Made this with petrole sole on a roll with coleslaw. Used a little olive oil in the pan and didn't need as much butter. Delicious! Also didn't smoke out my kitchen like I've done with other blackened recipes.
Was this supposed to be spicy? Very pretty for not Texas style.
I did this recipe on the bbq instead and it came out really good. Only thing that would have made it better is a butter sauce to top it.
I absolutely loved the combination of spices! And salmon was extremely delicious and satisfying.
We opted to grill the salmon but this was amazing and got a HUGE THUMBS UP from my husband who’s picky about how is salmon is seasoned. Thank you!
Less cayenne for the kids then it was delicious. Thanks!

Without the alterations the actual recipe deserves a 1-2 star tops!! First of all says to butter both sides then put butter side down in pan....really? Anyhow butter burns so just heat cast iron skillet and add a tablespoon of EVOO to the pan and cook at medium for 3 minutes skin side down, turn over and cook 4-5 more minutes. Who wants their salmon to taste like burnt butter? You can always drizzle it with melted butter when it’s done cooking. Oh and def add garlic powder and less cayenne. Following these changes will give the perfect blackened salmon.
This was delicious! Easy and so tasty. Almost too hot for hubby. I never make anything too hot for hubby. Normally, I'm crying and he's saying it's not hot. Thank you!
Didn't have paprika, only smoked paprika...but the recipe was lovely, simple, the salmon was crisp and blackened as advertised...very tasty. Nice.
Nice flavor! Moist. I will definitely be making it again
I know it's blackened but even by blackened standards it was bit too spicy for me.
Absolutely fantastic and so easy. My husband normally doesn't like salmon, but when I cook salmon now, he says as long as you cook it like the last time.

On golf trips, my buddies always request this. Can't believe anyone would change the ingredients in this cajun rub Crazy. It's perfect with chicken too. I always use an iron cast skillet placed on an outdoor grill even in winter. It allows for a very hot skillet with tons of smoky flavor. Otherwise, watch out for smoke alarms going off indoors. Use the highest heat possible for pure blackened salmon. For extra thick salmon steaks just throw in the oven at 350 for a few minutes after the skillet.
Good rub, didn’t have white pepper, will use on salmon and other proteins again

My husband grilled a large salmon filet with the spice rub on our open wood grill. The smoky essence added extra depth to the spicy rub! Our family had salmon tacos with a homemade Caribbean salsa making it a memorable Memorial Day!

This recipe is absolutely perfect !
I’ve used this recipe many times for myself and for company it’s my go to Salmon recipe.
Everyone loves it!
Came out great .
Awesome flavor. I cooked on the grill on 2X heavy duty foil and the skin was crisp and amazing.
Awesome recipe and I have made it 4 times and enjoyed it every time.
It was a big hit!

I love this blackening seasoning-I use it on other things. Also made this dish-I did not get too crazy with skillet heating, didn’t stink up the house and still turned out great. Conclusion-smoking hot skillet is not a requirement! Thanks for the recipe...I literally have this blackening in my spice cabinet to have made up/on hand!

Made this in cast iron skillet per recipe with excellent results. Only change was I cooked a piece of salmon for me and shrimp for my husband. Both were excellent. This recipe is a keeper. Next time we will cook outside on the Blackstone griddle and keep the spice fumes out of the kitchen.
Best salmon I ever made! Perfect blend of spices, the butter gives a nice finish. Highly recommended. This will be one of my go-to dinners.
Was easy and came out perfect. Thank you!
Tasted delicious! My family is picky and they loved it!

I really enjoyed this recipe. My son thought it was excellent. I skinned the fish fillets, dried them, spread with melted butter and put on the spice mixture. I only used about 1/3 of the cayenne, personal preference. I also added a bit powder chipolte . Next time I will use some smoked paprika. I also had 6 fillets, a couple of them were trout, which my family said was also excellent. I did not increase any of the ingredients and there was enough to cover all the fish.

This was awesome, I fixed as written except for changing out butter to olive oil. Bushed with OO added seasonings, drizzled OO in the pan. It blackened beautifully with no smoke. Made it for 2 with half the seasonings. Will be making this again and again.
Cut the Cayenne to 1/2.-- Sprinkle about 2/3 the amount on each side- reduce butter by 1/2 at least- Make this in a cast iron skillet on the grill side burner to avoid smoking out the house.

I had been looking for a really good blacking seasoning and I think I may have found it. This was really easy to make and the flavor was fantastic. I will definitely use this seasoning on other dishes.
Mike made it 3/19/20 -- excellent! keep skin on for good crunch
Delicious. I did exactly as the recipe stated. It was quick and easy.
Fantastic recipe!!!

First time cooking salmon at home, eat it at restaurants a lot. It was a little on the spicy side, but I loved it. I grilled it on my Forman Grill 4-5 minutes. Thermometer read 145. Skin pulled right off after cooking, but I couldn’t get it to come off before.
Added Cajun seasoning
Followed the tips on the top positive review, as well as cut back on the cayenne, and my family loved it -- kids too!
Fantastic! I followed the recipe exactly and the salmon came out moist and full of flavor. One suggestion...make sure you can open some windows. There is A LOT of smoke lol.
Extremely tasty. I tiny bit hot for me I would adjust cayenne according to palate.
Loved this! There is PLENTY of seasoning, so we didn't use it all. Will definitely make again and have enough leftover seasoning!

I rubbed top side of salmon with ghee and then added the dry rub mixture. I just left the skin side bare. Cooked in air fryer skin side down on 400 for 7 minutes. It was delicious and super quick and easy. I will be making this often.

This was just as good as any Salmon I've had at any of those expensive restaurants. The seasoning was perfect. The only changes I made was I used olive oil instead of butter and I baked it in the oven. Will definitely make it again and again and again.
I hate fish..all fish. But I love this recipe! Its spicy [which masks the salmon nicely] and very simple to cook.
Followed directions completely. It was east delicious and my husband said to make it again!!

i was so excited when I made this recipe ,as my husband is not a favorite of any kind of fish : let alone salmon. When I make cod he tolerates it . Salmon was out of the question Pan seared,baked ,or steamed it would sit on his plate untouch. So when prepared this recipe he was very dubious on trying it.
BAM !!! what a success he actually had 2 pieces of the salmon.
This recipe is full of flavor and the blacken salmon heightens the taste. regretfully I did not take pictures . In the future I will . This recipe will be the go to recipe when I cook Salmon. 
Thank you so much.

My husband went to the supermarket looking for something special to eat. He found some great looking fillets of salmon which had the skin on, so that is what we used. I followed the recipe for the most part, did not have white pepper, so used only black and instead of butter used olive oil to brush the fillets before putting the spices on it. I also added a bit of chili powder and garlic powder to the spices. Sorry Allrecipes but I cannot cook anything without garlic and onions . I did use a bit of butter mixed with olive oil when cooking the fish. I cooked the fish on an iron skillet and according to the cooking instructions. Our fish came out incredibly delicious and even though I am not a big fan of salmon, I liked this recipe very much ...double thumps up. Oh, when serving, I sprinkle a bit of fresh cilantro and the green part of scallions on top of the fish! Yummy
It was good, kind of spicy for my taste, but my family liked it
I used half the suggested amount of salt and it was still way too salty for my taste. The heat while nice, seems to render the flavor of the fish moot.

I LOVE this recipe! I made it last night for the first time and followed the suggestions made in the review by Nikki Falcone. Thank you for tweeting the cooking method as it can out moist and cooked perfectly. I served it over Cesar salad and my guest raved bout it!
So easy, fast, and yummy!
No changes needed. I loved this recipe just the way it is and that never happens.
Used canola instead of butter. Perfectly seasoned
Used canola instead of butter. Perfectly seasoned
I made it exactly with the recipe here and extremely hot cast iron it turned out great! My first blackened fish!
I used the spice mixture in this recipe. The salmon was quite tasty! We enjoyed it a lot!
I used the spice mixture in this recipe. The salmon was quite tasty! We enjoyed it a lot!
I made it and my family Loved it!!
Great flavor but too dry for my liking
This was very good, but there was a little too much cayenne pepper for our taste. Just cut the pepper a little if you don't like things REALLY spicy.
Excellent recipe for using cast iron skillet to blacken salmon. Taste of spices were reminiscent of New Orleans fare
